page.title: 02MIXED FARMING IN ABERNYTE
page.content: Southfield Farm is a typical farm on the higher ground in the area.It is 52.6 hectares and is 120metres above sea level.It has been owned by the same family for thirty years.It is a mixed farm and grows potatoes,barley turnips,oats,and grass for hay and silage.They have Suffolk Sheep and fatten cattle to send to market in Perth.Their busiest times are Dec. -March for lambing and Aug.-Sept. for harvest.The 2 full time workers are members of the family.They have old stone buildings and modern ones, which they use for the lambs,storing potatos and machinery (balers,seeders,turnip seeder,silage cutter,combines,ploughs, snow clearers,rotavaters,rollers).The farmhouse is old and modernised, the farm cottage was 3 homes but is now 1 house.Like all the farms here it is a very productive farm.
